Dome;Ahmad Tohari;Novels

;It is not easy for a man to regain his place in society after 12 years of living in exile on Island B. Moreover, he has indeed hurt the hearts of the people. Karman, that man, has also lost the people who were always present in his soul. His wife had married another man, some of his children had died, and those who remained didn't really know him anymore. Karman carries heavy historical sins and he can barely bear them. But in the midst of a life that is almost closed to him, Karman can still find a ray of love. He is entrusted by Pak Haji, a prominent man in his village whom he once betrayed because he himself turned away from God, to build the dome of the mosque in the village. Karman felt that he was finding himself again, finding the dignity of his life.

column10: Contemporary;Get ready for a whole new look into Jeff Kinney’s Diary of a Wimpy Kid! Introducing the newest Wimpy Kid author—Rowley Jefferson! But it’s finally time for readers to hear directly from Rowley in a journal of his own. In  Diary of an Awesome Friendly Kid
